DataElement.preferredName: Low Dose Computed Tomography of the Chest Lung Carcinoma Detection Year Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numerical response indicating the amount of years after low dose computed tomography of the chest when lung cancer was detected.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Low Dose Computed Tomography of the Chest Lung Carcinoma Detection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Computed tomography (CT) of the chest that uses less radiation than a standard chest CT.:A carcinoma originating in the lung. Lung carcinomas usually arise from the epithelium that lines the bronchial tree (bronchogenic carcinomas), and are classified as small cell or non-small cell carcinomas. Non-small cell lung carcinomas are usually adenocarcinomas, squamous cell carcinomas, or large cell carcinomas. Metastatic carcinomas to the lung are also common, and can be difficult to distinguish from primary tumors._The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Low Dose Computed Tomography of the Chest
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Computed tomography (CT) of the chest that uses less radiation than a standard chest CT.

Concepts.longName: Low Dose Computed Tomography of the Chest
Concepts.definition: Computed tomography (CT) of the chest that uses less radiation than a standard chest CT.

Property.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma originating in the lung. Lung carcinomas usually arise from the epithelium that lines the bronchial tree (bronchogenic carcinomas), and are classified as small cell or non-small cell carcinomas. Non-small cell lung carcinomas are usually adenocarcinomas, squamous cell carcinomas, or large cell carcinomas. Metastatic carcinomas to the lung are also common, and can be difficult to distinguish from primary tumors._The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma originating in the lung. Lung carcinomas usually arise from the epithelium that lines the bronchial tree (bronchogenic carcinomas), and are classified as small cell or non-small cell carcinomas. Non-small cell lung carcinomas are usually adenocarcinomas, squamous cell carcinomas, or large cell carcinomas. Metastatic carcinomas to the lung are also common, and can be difficult to distinguish from primary tumors.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the number of years of an event or between events.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: CCG PTCL (Center for Cancer Genomics - Peripheral T Cell Lymphoma)
